intro: Pentacme mindanensis, commonly known as the Mindanao pentacme, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many legumes. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers that typically bloom in clusters. It grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
